Problem:
Consider a quantum mechanical system where the state vector \\( \\psi(t) \\) is governed by the Schrödinger equation with a time-independent Hamiltonian H. We study the effect of applying a linear operator \\( U = e^{-iHt} \\) on the state vector at different times.

If at a certain time \\( t_1 < T \\), a new operator \\( V = e^{-iGt} \\) (G being another Hamiltonian) is applied as an intervention, will the final state \\( \\psi(T) \\) still retain properties only influenced by H and not by G?
Explanation: The intervention with \\( V \\) at time \\( t_1 \\) introduces a new dynamic influenced by Hamiltonian G. This change impacts the evolution of the state vector, modifying the trajectory and resultant properties at time T. Thus, the final state \\( \\psi(T) \\) will depend on both H and G.
